LOC -- His last name was Lozano, not Losano. 

Jose Lozano was the Secretary of Public Education and Fine Arts in the President Huerta administration, during the Mexican Revolution.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan: Thanks for the information on Lozano's last name. It seems titles were changing pretty often. I find him as Minister of Public Instruction earlier in 1913 and then appointed Minister of Communications and Public Works in September 1913. (Source) He then resigned that post in February 1914. (Source) Since this photo is dated November 1913, he should likely be identified as Minister of Communications and Public Works here, which we will add when the record is updated, as well as his full name of José María Lozano (1878-1933).
